text: The 1770 English cricket season was the 27th season following the earliest known codification of the Laws of Cricket. Details have survived of four eleven-a-side matches between significant teams. ==Matches== Four eleven-a- side match between significant teams are known to have taken place.ACS, p.24.Other matches in England 1770, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-02-10. *5 June - Brentford & Richmond v Essex - Richmond Green *20 August - London & Middlesex v Surrey - Artillery Ground *11 September - Chertsey v Hampton - Moulsey Hurst *4 October - Hambledon v Caterham - Broadhalfpenny Down ==Other events== The death of a Mr Johnson was reported in the Middlesex Journal on 29 June. Johnson died as a result of "a blow which he received from a cricket ball".Buckley, p.53. ==References== ==Bibliography== * * ==Further reading== * * * * * * Category:1770 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1764 to 1786
title: 1770 English cricket season
